snippet: Sohel Rana is under arrest after the collapse of his factory building last week left nearly 400 people dead, but until now he has been a powerful figure, trailed by his own biker gang.
abstract: Sohel Rana, owner of collapsed garment building in Bangladesh that left nearly 400 people dead, is under arrest as top Bangladeshi court seizes his assets and the public calls for his execution; case highlights how international garment brands in search of cheap labor to keep profits high have interlinked with local criminal figures like Rana, who hurriedly build new factories at low cost to meet Western demand.
lead_paragraph: Sohel Rana is under arrest after the collapse of his factory building last week left nearly 400 people dead, but until now he has been a powerful figure, trailed by his own biker gang.

headline.seo: Bangladesh Garment Industry Reliant on Flimsy Oversight
headline.main: The Most Hated Bangladeshi, Toppled From a Shady Empire
headline.print_headline: The Most Hated Bangladeshi, Toppled From a Shady Empire
